# Roleplay Rule 14 – Command Must Set an Example
Prospect Sector has **no security department** and **no antagonist roles**, but **Command** (Station Lead, HoP, QM, department heads) still carry higher expectations than normal crew.
Command roles: - Are **not beginner roles** — you are expected to understand your job and basic game systems. - Must maintain a **professional, cooperative tone** that encourages good RP. - Should **guide, coordinate, and support** the crew, not control them or act abusively. - Must avoid actions that harm station progression, morale, or structure. - Should use their authority responsibly and transparently.
Command has a major impact on how the round develops. When command behaves well, the crew usually follows. When command behaves poorly, chaos follows.
## Examples
### Acceptable: - A Station Lead admits a mistake over comms in a lighthearted way. - The HoP organizes departments, assists with job changes, and supports station direction. - The QM coordinates cargo priorities and loot sorting with clear communication. - Command votes to replace a Station Lead who is genuinely harming station progress. - A department head temporarily assigns access to allow a project to continue smoothly. - Command hosts small RP events (crew meetings, announcements, ceremonies) that do not disrupt station progression.
### Prohibited: - Command abusing authority to harass, grief, or punish crew without cause. - Making memey, trollish, or disruptive announcements that degrade RP quality. - Granting high access (engineering, atmos, cargo control, command areas) without a clear IC reason. - Demoting or promoting crew based on personal grudges or favoritism. - Command taking rare or high-value items for personal use without justification. - Command abandoning leadership responsibilities to run off and do unrelated personal projects. - Using authority to bypass rules, hinder progression, or excuse harmful behavior.
